content:
IRowset Interface

Definition

Provides an implementation of the OLE DB IRowset interface for use by applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("0C733A7C-2A1C-11CE-ADE5-00AA0044773D")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IRowset

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

AddRefRows(Int32, Int32[], Int32[], Int32[])

Adds a reference count to an existing row handle.

public void AddRefRows (int cRows, int[] hRows, out int[] refCounts, out int[] rowStatus);
Parameters
cRows
Int32

The number of rows for which to increment the reference count.

hRows
Int32[]

An array of row handles for which to increment the reference count. The reference count of row handles is incremented by one for each time they appear in the array.

refCounts
Int32[]

An array with cRows elements in which to return the new reference count for each row handle. The consumer allocates memory for this array. If refCounts is a null pointer, no reference counts are returned.

rowStatus
Int32[]

An array with cRows elements in which to return values indicating the status of each row specified in hRows.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetData(Int32, Int32, IntPtr)

Retrieves data from the rowset's copy of the row.

public void GetData (int hRow, int hAccessor, IntPtr pData);
Parameters
hRow
Int32

The handle of the row from which to get the data.

hAccessor
Int32

The handle of the accessor to use.

pData
IntPtr

A pointer to a buffer in which to return the data.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetNextRows(Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32, Int32[])

Fetches rows sequentially, remembering the previous position.

public void GetNextRows (int hChapter, int lRowsOffset, int cRows, out int cRowsObtained, out int[] hRows);
Parameters
hChapter
Int32

The chapter handle designating the rows to fetch.

lRowsOffset
Int32

The signed count of rows to skip before fetching rows. Deleted rows that the provider has removed from the rowset are not counted in the skip.

cRows
Int32

The number of rows to fetch. A negative number means to fetch backward.

cRowsObtained
Int32

A pointer to memory in which to return the actual number of fetched rows.

hRows
Int32[]

A pointer to memory in which to return an array of handles of the fetched rows.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ReleaseRows(Int32, Int32[], IntPtr, IntPtr, IntPtr)

Releases rows.

public int ReleaseRows (int cRows, int[] hRows, IntPtr rowOptions, IntPtr rowRefCounts, IntPtr rgRowStatus);
Parameters
cRows
Int32

The number of rows to release.

hRows
Int32[]

An array of handles of the rows to be released. The row handles do not need to form a logical cluster; they may have been obtained at separate times and need not be for contiguous underlying rows. Row handles are decremented by one reference count for each time they appear in the array.

rowOptions
IntPtr

An array of cRows elements containing bitmasks indicating additional options to be specified when a row is released.

rowRefCounts
IntPtr

An array with cRows elements in which to return the new reference count of each row.

rgRowStatus
IntPtr

An array with cRows elements in which to return values indicating the status of each row specified in hRows.

Returns
Int32

An Integer representing the result.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

RestartPosition(Int32)

Repositions the next fetch position to its initial position.

public int RestartPosition (int hChapter);
Parameters
hChapter
Int32

The chapter handle designating the rows on which to reposition.

Returns
Int32

An Integer representing the result.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
